Cuerpo: Hank's current research projects focus on operating systems, on parallel and distributed computing , on computer architecture (particularly " Simultaneous Multithreading " architectures) and on object-based languages and environments. He is former chair of ACM SIGOPS (the Special Interest Group on Operating Systems), and program chair for the 16th ACM Symposium on Operating Systems Principles , to be held in 1997. Before coming to Washington, he was a Consulting Engineer with Digital Equipment Corporation, where his work spanned the range from operating systems to architectures for distributed systems and workstations. Karlin, H.M. Levy, and M.K. In Proceedings of the Seventh ACM Conference on Architectural Support for Programming Languages and Operating Systems, October 1996. Michael M. Feeley, William E.
